definition: to overtake (another car)
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)
to overtake on a bend (driving)/(fig.) taking opportunity of tight corners to make swift progress (economy etc)

sentences.english: As for the lack of overtaking, the Ferrari man had no miracle solution.
sentences.chinese: 至于缺乏超车，这位法拉利车手没有什么好的办法。

sentences.english: A:But he's equally responsible because he tried to overtake you.
sentences.chinese: 但是他同样该承担责任，因为他试图超车。

sentences.english: It appears a short moment after he overtakes the Volvo: the omen.
sentences.chinese: 佛教徒超车过了沃尔沃没多久，预兆出现了。

sentences.english: The system also observes overtaking rules and speed limits.
sentences.chinese: 系统还能观察超车换道规则和最高限速。

sentences.english: Our huge college bus careens around small cars as it heads to the monumental site.
sentences.chinese: 我们所乘坐的大型巴士在小车群中左右变线超车。

sentences.english: When passing another car on two-lane roads, pass on the left.
sentences.chinese: 在两股道的公路上超车，必须从左车道超车。

sentences.english: When passing another car on two-lane roads, pass on the left.
sentences.chinese: 在两股道的公路上超车，必须从左车道超车。

sentences.english: When the other car passes you, you speed up and overtake on the right again.
sentences.chinese: 当这辆车超过你，你提速再从右侧超车。

sentences.english: I was carved up by a lunatic in a Porsche.
sentences.chinese: 一个开保时捷的疯子超车抢了我的道。

sentences.english: It is a good track with a very long straight and nice overtaking opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 这个赛道有很长的直道和很好的超车机会。

sentences.english: The road be too narrow to overtake .
sentences.chinese: 这条路太窄了，不能超车。

sentences.english: Tell us about that overtaking manoeuvre with Jenson.
sentences.chinese: 跟我们讲讲有关简森的超车策略。

sentences.english: We got behind a truck that purposely hogged the road so that we couldn't pass.
sentences.chinese: 我们碰上一辆故意堵着路不让我们超车的卡车。

sentences.english: Overtaking is not just about power, though.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，超车不仅仅在于动力。

definition: to change lanes
(of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
vehicle speed
to turn/to go around a corner
winding road/road curve
to change buses, trains etc
to reverse (a vehicle)/to drive backwards
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to make a sudden turn
accelerator (pedal)/gas pedal/throttle
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
emergency braking
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
